title: How to Create Digital Tattoos in Corel PaintShop® Pro

steps.headline: First, open your image in PaintShop Pro and make sure that the Edit tab is active.
Next, open the image you'll be working with.
steps.description: In this example we have a photo that should work quite well to show how a back tattoo would look after the design has been applied.

steps.headline: Open the tattoo design.
steps.description: It's preferable that the design have a transparent background like this PNG file we have of the butterfly.

steps.headline: To select the image, go to Selections > Select All or use the key combination CTRL + A on your keyboard.
Next, hit CTRL + C on the keyboard or choose Copy from the Edit menu.
Click on the photo and then select Edit > Paste as New Layer.
steps.description: You can then position and resize the image using the Pick tool.

steps.headline: After you have positioned the image properly, lower the layer Opacity; this will make the image appear more like a tattoo.
Next, use the Eraser tool to remove any parts that should be hidden or overlap the background.
The great part about this is that you can try unlimited styles and if you need to change the design or start over, it's completely painless.

text: First, open your image in PaintShop Pro and make sure that the Edit tab is active.  Next, open the image you'll be working with. In this example we have a photo that should work quite well to show how a back tattoo would look after the design has been applied. Open the tattoo design. It's preferable that the design have a transparent background like this PNG file we have of the butterfly. To select the image, go to Selections > Select All or use the key combination CTRL + A on your keyboard.  Next, hit CTRL + C on the keyboard or choose Copy from the Edit menu.  Click on the photo and then select Edit > Paste as New Layer. You can then position and resize the image using the Pick tool. After you have positioned the image properly, lower the layer Opacity; this will make the image appear more like a tattoo.  Next, use the Eraser tool to remove any parts that should be hidden or overlap the background.  The great part about this is that you can try unlimited styles and if you need to change the design or start over, it's completely painless.
